string-array.name: Subject
string-array.item: TO MARRY OR NOT TO MARRY

string-array.name: Problems
string-array.item:
1-Who makes it, has no need of it. 
Who buys it, has no use for it. 
Who uses it can neither see nor feel it. 
What is it?
2-What can travel around the world while staying in a corner?
3-During which month do people sleep the least?
4-What is made of water but if you put it into water it will die?
5-Im tall when Im young and Im short when Im old. What am I?
6-What has hands but can not clap?
7-You can drop me from the tallest building and I will be fine, but if you drop me in water I die. What am I?
8-What has a head and a tail, but no body?
9-What has an eye but can not see?
10-What gets wetter and wetter the more it dries?
11-Pauls height is six feet, hes an assistant at a butcher s shop, and wears size 9 shoes. What does he weigh?
12-There was a green house. Inside the green house there was a white house. Inside the white house there was a red house. Inside the red house there were lots of babies. What is it?
13-What kind of room has no doors or windows?
14-What kind of tree can you carry in your hand?
15-Which word in the dictionary is spelled incorrectly?
16-If you have me, you want to share me. If you share me, you havent got me. What am I?
18-Feed me and I live, yet give me a drink and I die.
19-A man is pushing his car along the road when he comes to a hotel. He shouts, "Im bankrupt!" Why?
20-How many of each species did Moses take on the ark with him?
21-Forward I am heavy, but backward I am not. What am I?
22-He has married many women, but has never been married. Who is he?
23-Take off my skin - I wont cry, but you will! What am I?
24-Imagine you are in a dark room. How do you get out?
25-What invention lets you look right through a wall?
26-What can you catch but not throw?
27-What is at the end of a rainbow?
28-What is as light as a feather, but even the worlds strongest man couldnt hold it for more than a minute?
29-Which weighs more, a pound of feathers or a pound of bricks?
30-What occurs once in every minute, twice in every moment, yet never in a thousand years?
31-What is black and white and red all over?
32-What has a neck but no head?
33-When is a door not a door?
34-What goes up but never comes down?
35-What has to be broken before you can use it?
36-Im tall when I’m young, and Im short when Im old. What am I?
37-What month of the year has 28 days?
38-What is full of holes but still holds water?
39-What question can you never answer yes to?
40-What is always in front of you but can’t be seen?
41-I shave every day, but my beard stays the same. What am I?
42-What can’t talk but will reply when spoken to?
43-The more of this there is, the less you see. What is it?
44-David’s parents have three sons: Snap, Crackle, and what’s the name of the third son?
45-I’m light as a feather, yet the strongest person can’t hold me for five minutes. What am I?
46-What gets bigger when more is taken away?
48-If you’re running in a race and you pass the person in second place, what place are you in?
49-It belongs to you, but other people use it more than you do. What is it?
50-What has a thumb and four fingers, but is not a hand?
53-What has 13 hearts, but no other organs?
54-I am an odd number. Take away a letter and I become even. What number am I?
55-If two’s company, and three’s a crowd, what are four and five?
56-Two fathers and two sons are in a car, yet there are only three people in the car. How?
57-If there are three apples and you take away two, how many apples do you have?
58-What five-letter word becomes shorter when you add two letters to it?
59-What begins with an “e” and only contains one letter?
60-What would you find in the middle of Toronto?
61-What 4-letter word can be written forward, backward or upside down, and can still be read from left to right?
63-I am a word of letters three; add two and fewer there will be. What word am I?
64-I am always hungry and will die if not fed, but whatever I touch will soon turn red. What am I?
65-How many letters are there in the English alphabet?
66-When things go wrong, what can you always count on?
67-The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
68-What has a head, a tail, is brown, and has no legs?

69-A doctor and a bus driver are both in love with the same woman, an attractive girl named Sarah. The bus driver had to go on a long bus trip that would last a week. Before he left, he gave Sarah seven apples. Why?
71-Look in my face, I am somebody; Look in my back, I am nobody.\NWhat am I?
72-What do you call cheese that belongs to someone else?
73-When will water stop running down hill?
74-When can you add two to eleven and get one as the correct answer?
75-Five apples are in a basket. How do you divide them among five girls so that each girl gets an apple, but one apple remains in the basket?
76-You use a knife to slice my head and weep beside me when I am dead. What am I?
77-What is the worst vegetable to have on a ship?
78-Which one of Santas reindeer can be seen on Valentines day?
79-Im not clothes but I cover your body \nThe more Im used, the thinner I grow.\nWhat am I?
80-What did the bee say to the flower?
81-I have a little house in which I live all alone. It has no doors or windows, and if I want to go out I must break through the wall. What am I?

string-array.name: Solutions
string-array.item: February (there are fewer nights in February).
None, Moses wasnt on the ark Noah was.
Forward I am ton, backwards I am not.
Neither, they both weigh one pound.
They are a grandfather, father and son.
An apple a day keeps the doctor away!
When you add two hours to eleven oclock, you get one oclock.
Give the fifth girl her apple in the basket.
